text: when it comes to the Olympics it's never
really just about the games this year
the world's opinion of Russia is mixed
ahead of the Winter Olympics a survey of
38 countries by the pew research center
found only nine have favorable views of
the Olympic host Europe in the Middle
East have some of the more negative
views now America Russia's Cold War
adversary lie somewhere in the middle
but remember back to nineteen eighty the
u.s. boycott of the Summer Olympics in
Moscow and later the Soviet Union and
its allies stayed away from the Los
Angeles Summer Games yes things have
certainly changed but distrusts still
lingers few found in a 2012 survey that
more than half of Americans don't trust
Russian President Vladimir Putin in
global affairs this year Putin's views
on homosexuality are big topic he's been
widely criticized internationally for
restricting gay rights pew found that
inside Russia three quarters of the
population agreed with their president
so you might think that when Pew asked
Americans what they thought of the games
being held in Sochi gay rights would be
an issue of concern forty-four percent
think holding the games in Russia is a
bad idea but only four percent of those
said it was because of anti-gay laws
sixty-two percent of that critical crowd
said security and the threat of
terrorism was their biggest concern but
it turns out folks might mellow pew
found that before the Beijing Games in
2008 a large number of Americans thought
having them in China was a bad idea but
once the games were underway that number
went down in more than half were
satisfied David Botti BBC News
Washington
